intro: Florestina latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf forest plant, is a species native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenia. The plant is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
